intro: Sida hilaireana, commonly known as the African mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features hairy, alternate leaves that are typically ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Sida hilaireana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
